skill.name: web-design-guidelines
skill.description: Review UI code for Web Interface Guidelines compliance. Use when asked to "review my UI", "check accessibility", "audit design", "review UX", or "check my site against best practices".
skill.summary: Review UI code against Web Interface Guidelines to ensure accessible, user-friendly web interfaces.
skill.author: vercel-labs

security_audit.summary: This is a declarative documentation skill with no code execution. Static findings were false positives: markdown backticks flagged as shell commands, metadata text flagged as cryptographic algorithms, and an intentional GitHub URL flagged as hardcoded URL. The skill safely fetches markdown guidelines and performs static analysis only.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Text Pattern Misidentified as Cryptographic Algorithm
high_findings.description: The static scanner incorrectly identified text patterns in YAML frontmatter as cryptographic algorithms. 'MD' in 'Web Interface Guidelines', 'audit' and 'accessibility' in descriptions were flagged as weak crypto. These are ordinary English words, not code.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Text patterns in YAML frontmatter are ordinary words, not cryptographic code. Scanner confused 'MD', 'audit', 'accessibility' with crypto terms.

medium_findings.title: False Positive: Markdown Backticks Misidentified as Shell Command Execution
medium_findings.description: The static scanner flagged markdown backticks for inline code formatting as shell backtick command execution. These are markdown syntax for code spans, not actual shell commands.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Markdown backticks for inline code formatting (file:line) and code fences with URLs are not shell command execution. Standard documentation syntax.

medium_findings.title: False Positive: Intentional Hardcoded URL
medium_findings.description: The static scanner flagged a GitHub URL as a hardcoded URL concern. This URL is intentionally hardcoded as the documented source for fetching Web Interface Guidelines from the official Vercel repository.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: The URL to githubusercontent.com is the intentional, trusted source for guidelines. No secrets involved, aligns with skill's documented purpose.

content.user_title: Review UI code for design compliance
content.value_statement: Claude can automatically review UI code against established web design guidelines, catching accessibility issues, usability problems, and best practice violations before deployment. This skill fetches the latest guidelines and performs static analysis to identify improvements.
actual_capabilities: Fetches latest Web Interface Guidelines from official Vercel repository
Reviews UI code against accessibility rules (WCAG compliance)
Checks for usability and user experience best practices
Validates design patterns against established guidelines
Outputs findings in terse file:line format for easy navigation
Can review entire codebases or specific file patterns
limitations: Only reviews against provided guidelines; cannot evaluate subjective design preferences
Does not modify code or suggest implementations
Requires network access to fetch latest guidelines
Cannot validate runtime behavior or interactive functionality

use_cases.title: Accessibility compliance review
use_cases.description: Review a React component or HTML file for WCAG accessibility compliance, checking for proper ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation support, color contrast, and semantic markup.

use_cases.title: Design system audit
use_cases.description: Audit an entire codebase or design system against web interface guidelines to identify inconsistencies, anti-patterns, and areas for improvement.
use_cases.target_user: Design system engineers and UI architects

use_cases.title: Pre-deployment code review
use_cases.description: Before deploying new UI features, run a quick review to catch design guideline violations early in the development cycle.

prompt_templates.title: Basic UI review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the web-design-guidelines skill to review my UI code. Check the following files against the Web Interface Guidelines: [FILE_OR_PATTERN]

prompt_templates.title: Accessibility-focused review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the web-design-guidelines skill to audit my interface for accessibility compliance. Focus on WCAG guidelines, ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, and semantic HTML in these files: [FILE_OR_PATTERN]
prompt_templates.scenario: When accessibility is the primary concern

prompt_templates.title: Design system consistency check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the web-design-guidelines skill to review my entire design system. Check all components against the Web Interface Guidelines and report any inconsistencies or violations: [PATH_TO_DESIGN_SYSTEM]

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive codebase audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the web-design-guidelines skill to perform a comprehensive review of my web application. Review all files matching this pattern and provide a detailed report of all guideline violations: [PATTERN]

best_practices: Run the skill early in development to catch issues before they compound
Address findings in priority order: accessibility issues first, then usability improvements
Combine with manual testing for keyboard navigation and screen reader compatibility
Keep guidelines up to date by using the skill regularly
anti_patterns: Ignoring accessibility findings because they seem minor; small issues compound into significant barriers
Using the skill as a substitute for user testing with real users
Reviewing only new code while legacy violations accumulate unchecked
Focusing solely on passing automated checks without understanding the underlying principles

faq.question: How often should I run this skill?
faq.answer: Run the skill during code reviews, before merging UI changes, and periodically audit your codebase. The skill fetches the latest guidelines, so you always get current best practices.

faq.question: Does this replace manual accessibility testing?
faq.answer: No. This skill catches common issues automatically, but manual testing with screen readers and keyboard-only navigation is still essential for comprehensive accessibility.

faq.question: What guidelines does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill fetches guidelines from the official vercel-labs web-interface-guidelines repository on GitHub. These are community-vetted best practices for web interfaces.

faq.question: Can I use this with any framework?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidelines cover fundamental web standards (HTML, CSS, ARIA) that apply to any framework including React, Vue, Svelte, and plain HTML projects.

faq.question: How do I prioritize the findings?
faq.answer: Prioritize accessibility issues first (WCAG violations), then usability problems, then consistency improvements. The skill outputs file:line format for easy navigation to each issue.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reads files and reports findings. It does not modify, create, or delete any code. You apply the fixes manually based on the findings.
